alert.note: Alert for Fairfield; Kershaw; Lancaster (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 05 at 5:45AM EST until January 08 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in South Carolina... Wateree River At Lake Wateree affecting Fairfield, Lancaster and Kershaw Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY MONDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Wateree River at Lake Wateree. * WHEN...Until early Monday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 100.4 feet, The piers on the Wildlife Road bridge over Singleton Creek become submerged. At 102.5 feet, Roadways near Beaver Creek become flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:00 AM EST Friday the stage was 100.7 feet. - Bankfull stage is 100.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 4:00 AM EST Friday was 100.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage early Sunday afternoon and continue falling to 98.5 feet Tuesday evening. - Flood stage is 100.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 545 PM EST.
